DOC.brief_summary: This single center , prospective , observational study use Gonal-f control ovarian hyperstimulation ( COH ) subject undergoing ovulation induction/ intrauterine insemination ( OI/IUI ) therapy across Taiwan . It observe previous study COH follicle stimulate hormone ( FSH ) consider one positive predictor ongoing pregnancy . Many study past tried predict FSH threshold , define FSH dose day follicle > 10 mm diameter , study conduct date determine predictive factor monofollicular development COH IUI cycle . Monofollicular growth contribute significantly reduction multiple pregnancy thus minimize risk associated pregnancy . This study would provide preliminary data factor associate monofollicular development Gonal-f treat cycle use low dose step-up regimen .
DOC.brief_title: Predictive Factors Ovarian Response Ovulation Induction With Intrauterine Insemination Gonal-f Low-dose Regimen
DOC.detailed_description: Ovarian stimulation improve cycle fecundity rate part increase number follicle available fertilisation correct subtle , unpredictable ovulatory dysfunction . Intrauterine insemination establish treatment subfertility due cervical factor , male factor , unexplained etiology . Ovulation induction aim selection single follicle would able reach pre-ovulatory size rupture . The ovarian sensitivity FSH ( FSH threshold ) identify avoid multiple follicular development hence , lowest effective dose FSH use treat infertility . Treatment subject individualise monitor serum estradiol ( E2 ) measurement ultrasound scan ovary assess endometrial thickness . It observe early study OI unexplained non-conception , induction one follicle improve ongoing pregnancy rate increase risk multiple pregnancy . Therefore , reduce number multiple pregnancy , IUI cycle unexplained non-conception , monofollicular growth suggest . The 'low-dose step-up ' protocol suitable method establish appropriate FSH threshold , involve start FSH dose 75 IU/day give 7 14 day . Subsequent dose increment 37.5 IU/day weekly interval determine base ovarian response , usually follicle diameter ≥10 mm see ovary . Human chorionic gonadotrophin ( hCG ) inject lead follicle ≥18 mm diameter . OBJECTIVES Primary objective : - To describe outcome treatment cohort subject undergoing OI/IUI therapy use Gonal-f Secondary objective : - To explore predictive factor ovarian response OI/IUI therapy use low-dose step-up regimen This study plan enrol 30 female subject 1 centre Taiwan . Each subject receive 3 treatment cycle . Before undergo control ovarian stimulation Gonal-f , thorough gynaecologic endocrinologic evaluation subject perform subject give first administration Gonal-f low dose step regimen control ovarian stimulation baseline visit . The objective Gonal-f therapy develop single mature graafian follicle ovum liberate administration hCG . If subject fail respond adequately 4 week treatment , cycle abandon subject would recommence treatment high start dose abandon cycle . If excessive response obtain , treatment would stop hCG administration withheld next cycle treatment would start dosage low previous cycle . Each enrol subject follow confirmation pregnancy status .
DOC.criteria: Female subject age 20 35 year Subjects regular menstrual cycle 25 35 day Subjects ovaries Subjects normal uterine cavity investigate either ultrasound scan hysteroscopy patent fallopian tube Subjects baseline serum FSH level within normal range clinic Subjects whose male partner 's semen consider adequate IUI accordance centre 's standard practice Subjects contraindication pregnant and/or carry pregnancy term Subjects extrauterine pregnancy abortion past 3 month Subjects abnormal gynaecological bleeding undetermined origin Subjects history OHSS Subjects know hypersensitivity recombinant FSH preparation recipient
